title: The Democrats Who Want to Abandon Florida
sub_head: They used to call it a swing state.
body:
In recent years Republican voters have become more diverse and this trend has been so powerful in one big swing state that some Democrats are suddenly wondering if they should even bother competing there. Politicoâ€™s Sabrina Rodriguez reports today:
Some freedom-loving Floridians have worried that newcomers who have fled dysfunctional governance up north will bring blue-state politics with them. But whether imported or home-grown, these days Floridians seem inclined to leave Democrats behind. Ms. Rodriguez interviews the head of a Democratic super PAC who is urging donors not to write off the Sunshine State:
